name: Best Actor in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role

candidates.notes: Nomination and award were posthumous. Finch became the first posthumous winner in an acting category. His widow Eletha Finch and screenwriter Paddy Chayefsky accepted the award on his behalf.

Sylvester Stallone becomes the third person to be nominated for both acting and writing in the same year, following Charles Chaplin for The Great Dictator (1940) and Orson Welles for Citizen Kane (1941).

name: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role

name: Best Actress in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role

name: Best Actress in a Supporting Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role

candidates.notes: Danilo Donati was not present at the awards ceremony. Presenter Tamara Dobson accepted the award on his behalf.
Lina Wertmüller becomes the first woman to be nominated for Best Director.

candidates.notes: 'Network' becomes the second film to win three awards for acting, following A Streetcar Named Desire (1951).
